result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Defendant Kenneth J Ringer in court.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Kenneth J Ringer.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status.
Defense advises the court of circumstances and is likely to file a motion to modify bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Retainer filed by Atty Daniel Murray

Adjustment Number: 22A 034887,
Payable Number: 474405,
Receipt Number: 22R 038001,
Amount: $20.00

11:02 AM Defendant Kenneth J Ringer in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Case called for status. 
Defendant is not currently represented and does not qualify for public defender representation. 
Court passes the case to allow the Defendant to fill out the Petition for Appointment of Attorney.
11:25 AM Court recalls the case with the same appearances. 
Defendant spoke with an attorney and intends to hire counsel.
Defendant to make sure attorney can be present for next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 08/01/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:39 PM Defendant Kenneth J Ringer in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prior: N88 W14822 Main St C10, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
